content:
• Friday, February 24, 2012
  • AUO

    AU Optronics (AUO +5.1%) and LG Display (LPL +2%) rallied after AUO's president said prices for...

    AU Optronics (AUO +5.1%) and LG Display (LPL +2%) rallied after AUO's president said prices for some LCD panels have risen recently due to tight capacity for advanced "7.5G" manufacturing lines, positive news for an industry that saw prices crash last summer and fall. He added AUO will focus on "new technologies" (are OLEDs among them?) to mitigate the impact of new Chinese capacity.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:50 PM
  • TMUS

    More on the vetoed Sprint/MetroPCS deal: Sprint was reportedly offering a premium of 30% to...

    More on the vetoed Sprint/MetroPCS deal: Sprint was reportedly offering a premium of 30% to MetroPCS' Wednesday close of $10.28; shares jumped on Thursday following MetroPCS' Q4 report, and closed today at $12.01. Execs at both companies expected a deal to be announced by week's end, but Sprint's board shot down the proposal on Wednesday. PCS +7.9% AH. LEAP +5%. S +0.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:35 PM | 1 Comment
  • AVGO

    Broadcom (BRCM) -3.7% AH after the chipmaker discloses it has been notified by the SEC of an...

    Broadcom (BRCM) -3.7% AH after the chipmaker discloses it has been notified by the SEC of an investigation into its "accounting practices related to litigation reserves." Broadcom adds it believes the investigation is the result of allegations made by an ex-employee in April.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:32 PM
  • NIHD

    NII Holdings (NIHD -4.5%) finished lower again today, adding to yesterday's drubbing as JP...

    NII Holdings (NIHD -4.5%) finished lower again today, adding to yesterday's drubbing as JP Morgan cuts the stock to Neutral following its weak Q4 results and poor guidance yesterday. The firm notes: “While we continue to believe in the long-term case for NIHD, we do not see positive catalysts in the short term.” Separately, BofA Merrill Lynch also lowered its rating to Underperform.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:48 PM
  • BEL

    Orient-Express Hotels (OEH +12.5%) finishes the day solidly higher after posting a smaller than...

    Orient-Express Hotels (OEH +12.5%) finishes the day solidly higher after posting a smaller than expected loss for Q4. Revenue is currently running above last year's level, largely due to healthy demand in the luxury travel sector.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM
  • OPEN

    OpenTable (OPEN +2.2%) finished higher after CEO Matt Roberts appeared (video) on Jim Cramer's...

    OpenTable (OPEN +2.2%) finished higher after CEO Matt Roberts appeared (video) on Jim Cramer's Mad Money. Roberts argued OpenTable still had plenty of growth potential, given that only 12% of U.S. restaurant reservations are currently made online, and declared Google (NASDAQ:GOOG) to be a partner rather than a competitor, in spite of its acquisition of Zagat.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM
  • MCPIQ

    Molycorp (MCP -7.8%) shares are punished after the company warns of higher production costs in...

    Molycorp (MCP -7.8%) shares are punished after the company warns of higher production costs in the current quarter and says it can't provide a specific forecast. "One of the things we have learned in 2011 is not to predict what prices of rare earth will do because [2011] was a roller coaster," CEO Mark Smith says. J.P. Morgan cuts its price target to $27 from $39.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM
  • HSTM

    Healthstream (HSTM +2.9%) gains on positive comments out of Craig-Hallum today, noting the...

    Healthstream (HSTM +2.9%) gains on positive comments out of Craig-Hallum today, noting the company is actively reviewing potential acquisitions to compliment its business across a number of business segments. The firm says the stock has excellent momentum and reiterates a Buy.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:51 PM
  • AAXN

    Taser (TASR -1.1%) dips after Craig-Hallum cut the shares to Hold, citing a disappointing...

    Taser (TASR -1.1%) dips after Craig-Hallum cut the shares to Hold, citing a disappointing quarterly report and lack of visibility into its video/data business. The firm also notes the company is losing traction going into the X2 replacement cycle.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM
  • IPG

    Shares of Interpublic Group (IPG +5.3%) push through the days highs after beating Q4 estimates...

    Shares of Interpublic Group (IPG +5.3%) push through the days highs after beating Q4 estimates earlier. Earnings rose a better-than-expected 32% as revenue pushed higher and reduced costs contributed to stronger margins. The company also approved a new $300 million stock-buyback program.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:43 PM
  • RRD

    R.R. Donnelley (RRD +4%) is initiated at Overweight with a $16 price target by Barclays. Despite...

    R.R. Donnelley (RRD +4%) is initiated at Overweight with a $16 price target by Barclays. Despite the secular challenges facing the entire publishing and printing industry, Barclays says RRD is the top pick in its new multi-sector "special opportunities" coverage area, noting the company's scale and attractive 8% dividend yield.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM
  • SHLDQ

    The improbable rally in Sears (SHLD +7%) rolls on, following up yesterday’s 19% surge with...

    The improbable rally in Sears (SHLD +7%) rolls on, following up yesterday’s 19% surge with another gain as investors buy into Eddie Lampert’s plan to rebuild the brand. The stock is up 106% YTD, but Credit Suisse's Gary Balter says while Sears’ planned asset sales “are steps in the right direction... the hole that has been created will not be as easy to climb out off as investors believe."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:32 PM | 10 Comments
  • EHC

    HealthSouth (HLS +3.4%) trades higher after beating Q4 EPS estimates late yesterday, as patient...

    HealthSouth (HLS +3.4%) trades higher after beating Q4 EPS estimates late yesterday, as patient discharges and net revenue grew. Profit actually dropped 94% Y/Y however, as results were skewed by a sizable tax benefit in the prior period.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM
  • AOL

    Activist investor Starboard Value nominates five people for election to AOL's (AOL -1.4%) board,...

    Activist investor Starboard Value nominates five people for election to AOL's (AOL -1.4%) board, likely the start of an intense debate about AOL's business strategy. Starboard, which owns ~5.2% of AOL's shares outstanding, says in a letter that it has engaged in "ongoing dialog" with AOL's management over the last two months, but claims its conversations have stalled.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM
  • PRLB

    Proto Labs (NYSE:PRLB) CEO Brad Cleveland says (video) it's in a "great position" to use some of...

    Proto Labs (NYSE:PRLB) CEO Brad Cleveland says (video) it's in a "great position" to use some of its IPO cash for an acquisition or key investments in the technology space, although no company is on the radar at the moment. Shares trade at $29.43, +83.9% from their IPO price.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:34 PM | 2 Comments
  • TGT

    Target (TGT +1.5%) gets an added boost from positive comments out of Baird earlier this morning....

    Target (TGT +1.5%) gets an added boost from positive comments out of Baird earlier this morning. The firm says that despite the mostly in-line Q4 results, it's encouraged by the retail giant's improved sales momentum, healthy margins and potential to beat comps.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM | 1 Comment
  • BV-OLD

    Bazaarvoice (NASDAQ:BV-OLD), a provider of social media engagement and marketing software for...

    Bazaarvoice (NASDAQ:BV-OLD), a provider of social media engagement and marketing software for consumer brands, is trading at $16.82, up 40.2% from an IPO price of $12. The company, which competes with Constant Contact (CTCT +2%) and Salesforce.com (CRM +10.4%), sold 9.48M shares in its offering. It generated revenue of $74.7M (+65% Y/Y) in the 9 months ending Jan. 31, and had a net loss of $18M (S-1)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:24 PM
  • NBR

    Nabors Industries (NBR +1.9%) gets a boost from an upgrade to Buy at Argus, citing its strong...

    Nabors Industries (NBR +1.9%) gets a boost from an upgrade to Buy at Argus, citing its strong international presence, the new CEO's effective capital allocations and expectations for positive free cash flow this year.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM
  • FISV

    Fiserv (FISV +1.7%) is trading higher today, after saying it's received board approval to buy...

    Fiserv (FISV +1.7%) is trading higher today, after saying it's received board approval to buy back an additional 10M shares, equal to about 7% of its float.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM
  • RBCN

    Rubicon Technology (RBCN -17.8%) crashes after its Q4 miss and Q1 guidance demonstrate the full...

    Rubicon Technology (RBCN -17.8%) crashes after its Q4 miss and Q1 guidance demonstrate the full extent of the LED industry's woes. Sterne Agee (Underperform) expects sales of Rubicon's mainstay 6" LED wafers to remain weak through Q2, while Piper (Underweight) thinks pricing could stay under pressure into 2013. LED wafer equipment maker GT Advanced Technologies (GTAT -3.1%) is falling in sympathy.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM
  • CRUS

    Cirrus Logic (CRUS +3.1%), whose shares have already surged thanks to booming Apple orders, is...

    Cirrus Logic (CRUS +3.1%), whose shares have already surged thanks to booming Apple orders, is rallying again following an upgrade to Buy from Oppenheimer's Dick Schafer. Schafer believes Cirrus, whose audio codec chips are used in the iPhone 4S and iPad 2, is unlikely to lose business with Apple this year, and shares have more room to run given a reasonable valuation of 13x next year's EPS.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:50 PM
  • CBI

    Chicago Bridge & Iron (CBI +1.3%) moves up after its Q4 EPS topped estimates late yesterday....

    Chicago Bridge & Iron (CBI +1.3%) moves up after its Q4 EPS topped estimates late yesterday. Revenue jumped a stronger-than-expected 22% Y/Y, as the engineering-and-construction company benefited from broad-based revenue growth. Large overseas infrastructure projects have given a boost to its top line recently - particularly in the energy sector - with storage projects in Russia and liquefied natural gas facilities elsewhere.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:39 PM

  • Crude oil continues to surge, the bull run given a renewed push from an IAEA warning on Iran's...

    Crude oil continues to surge, the bull run given a renewed push from an IAEA warning on Iran's nuclear program. WTI crude +1.3% at $109.23, Brent crude +1.2% to $125.06.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:18 PM | 19 Comments
  • CUBE

    CubeSmart (CUBE -2.5%) dips after being downgraded to Neutral at Baird this morning, citing the...

    CubeSmart (CUBE -2.5%) dips after being downgraded to Neutral at Baird this morning, citing the company's lackluster guidance call yesterday. The firm also lowers its price target to $12 from $13.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:13 PM
  • MNST

    UBS weighs in on Monster Beverage's (MNST +1.7%) Q4 results, saying its growth story remains...

    UBS weighs in on Monster Beverage's (MNST +1.7%) Q4 results, saying its growth story remains intact. The firm reiterates its Buy rating based on its confidence in the company's ability to achieve double digit international growth, gain market share, and develop new products. Separately, Goldman also raises its price target on the shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:07 PM
  • TLB

    Shares of Talbots (TLB +2.6%) shoot higher after a report tips off that the firm could see...

    Shares of Talbots (TLB +2.6%) shoot higher after a report tips off that the firm could see indications of interest for an acquisition bid starting as soon as today.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM
  • CLDX

    Celldex Therapeutics (CLDX -11.2%) is pummeled after pricing its offering of 10.5M common shares...

    Celldex Therapeutics (CLDX -11.2%) is pummeled after pricing its offering of 10.5M common shares at a discounted $3.85 each. CLDX had closed yesterday at $4.36.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:51 PM
  • PPS

    UBS upgrades the Apartment Sector to Marketweight from Underweight, citing relative growth and...

    UBS upgrades the Apartment Sector to Marketweight from Underweight, citing relative growth and valuation: Post Properties (PPS +1.8%), Camden Property (CPT +1%) and Colonial Properties (CLP +1.5%) are all upgraded to Buy.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • DECK

    Credit Suisse responds to the weak guidance accompanying Deckers' (DECK -11.6%) Q4 report by...

    Credit Suisse responds to the weak guidance accompanying Deckers' (DECK -11.6%) Q4 report by downgrading shares to Neutral. The combination of slowing growth and a growing reliance on the company's own retail sales (which require more overhead) limits the stock's upside potential, CS claims. Piper (Neutral) expects shares to remain pressured until 2H visibility improves. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:34 PM
  • KND

    Kindred Healthcare (KND -14.7%) shares plunge after Q4 results miss estimates as "significant...

    Kindred Healthcare (KND -14.7%) shares plunge after Q4 results miss estimates as "significant Medicare cuts" hurt its nursing center and rehab businesses. Susquehanna says the results and updated year-ahead guidance indicate Medicare reimbursement changes implemented in October are looking to be more difficult than expected.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM | 1 Comment
  • CVLT

    CommVault (CVLT -4.8%) shares sink after partner Dell's (DELL-OLD +1.1%) purchase of a developer...

    CommVault (CVLT -4.8%) shares sink after partner Dell's (DELL-OLD +1.1%) purchase of a developer of software for backing up applications running on servers similar to what CVLT makes. Stifel Nicolaus says CVLT's tech is broader and thus isn't worried about the competition, but the acquisition dampens the likelihood of a long-rumored Dell takeover of CVLT.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:24 PM
  • OVTI

    Though off yesterday's AH highs, OmniVision (OVTI +7.3%) is still rallying after posting FQ3...

    Though off yesterday's AH highs, OmniVision (OVTI +7.3%) is still rallying after posting FQ3 revenue and FQ4 guidance that blew past depressed expectations. During its earnings call, OmniVision partly attributed its top-line performance to strong demand for lower-resolution image sensors. Canaccord (Buy) expects the resolution of yield issues for 8MP sensors to drive growth and margin improvement.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:20 PM
  • GPS

    Gap (GPS -3.5%) ticks lower despite beating Q4 estimates late yesterday. Earnings fell 40% as...

    Gap (GPS -3.5%) ticks lower despite beating Q4 estimates late yesterday. Earnings fell 40% as margins continued to weaken, and overextension of its store network in the U.S. and merchandising struggles continue to pose headwinds for the casual-apparel retailer.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:17 PM
  • AIG

    AIG (AIG +2.2%) shares jump after reporting Q4 earnings, trading briefly above the $29 price the...

    AIG (AIG +2.2%) shares jump after reporting Q4 earnings, trading briefly above the $29 price the U.S. Treasury got when it sold a portion of its AIG holdings in a “re-IPO" in May 2011. If AIG shares can stay there, Treasury likely will attempt a sale of another chunk of its 77% stake. But the price point may prove an impediment to further appreciation in the shares, Bernstein says.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:08 PM
  • WCRX

    Warner Chilcott (WCRX -1.7%) dips after missing on Q4 revenue estimates earlier this morning. A...

    Warner Chilcott (WCRX -1.7%) dips after missing on Q4 revenue estimates earlier this morning. A surge in profit over the prior year period masked a Y/Y decline in overall revenue, which was dragged down by heavy debt costs and sagging sales of its Actonel osteoporosis treatment.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM
  • JOBS

    William Blair adds its two cents to 51job's (JOBS +11.2%) solid Q4 report yesterday, saying the...

    William Blair adds its two cents to 51job's (JOBS +11.2%) solid Q4 report yesterday, saying the results should alleviate investor concerns about any macro-driven slowdown. The firm maintains its Outperform rating on the stock.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM
  • AMD

    UBS analyst Uche Orji boosts his target price on Advanced Micro Devices (AMD +1.8%) to $11 from...

    UBS analyst Uche Orji boosts his target price on Advanced Micro Devices (AMD +1.8%) to $11 from $9, and lifts EPS estimates for 2012 to $0.89 from $0.65 and for 2013 to $1.18 from $0.81. Based on checks after AMD’s analyst meeting and Q4 graphics processor market data, UBS expects a richer product mix to drive higher margins.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:36 AM
  • KMI

    Shares of Kinder Morgan (KMI +1.2%) move up along with El Paso on earlier reports that Apollo...

    Shares of Kinder Morgan (KMI +1.2%) move up along with El Paso on earlier reports that Apollo Management is nearing a $7B acquisition of El Paso's oil and gas exploration unit.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM
  • CRM

    Estimates and PTs are rising for Salesforce.com (CRM +8.5%) after it delivered an FQ4 beat and...

    Estimates and PTs are rising for Salesforce.com (CRM +8.5%) after it delivered an FQ4 beat and strong top-line guidance. Morgan Stanley expects continued margin expansion, while Deutsche thinks it's time for Salesforce to pursue major new acquisitions. However, SA's Paulo Santos is concerned about how Salesforce's deferred revenue growth was boosted by longer invoicing periods. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM
  • OWW

    Orbitz (OWW +9%), which was down 18% YTD as of yesterday's close, jumps after Jefferies raises...

    Orbitz (OWW +9%), which was down 18% YTD as of yesterday's close, jumps after Jefferies raises its estimates and PT, albeit while maintaining a Hold. The firm says it's encouraged by signs of progress towards better growth and profitability, but remains concerned about competition, slowing air travel sales growth, and challenges for Orbitz's HotelClub site.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM
  • HRB

    H&R Block (HRB +1.8%) says its total prepared tax returns have increased 6.7% in the tax...

    H&R Block (HRB +1.8%) says its total prepared tax returns have increased 6.7% in the tax season to date, sparked by a 16.7% Y/Y rise in digital returns. "It is still early, but we believe that we are clearly on pace to gain share in both our retail and digital channels this tax season," CEO Bill Cobb says.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM
  • EROC

    Eagle Rock Energy (EROC -3.5%) trades lower after Wells Fargo cut the shares to Market Perform,...

    Eagle Rock Energy (EROC -3.5%) trades lower after Wells Fargo cut the shares to Market Perform, saying it expects natural gas fundamentals to deteriorate over the near term. The firm also lowers its target range to $10 - $12 from $11 - $13.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM | 1 Comment
  • VVUS

    Even on a relatively calm day, shares of Vivus (NASDAQ:VVUS) can't help but kick up a 5.1% gain...

    Even on a relatively calm day, shares of Vivus (NASDAQ:VVUS) can't help but kick up a 5.1% gain after landing a FDA panel recommendation for its weight-loss drug earlier this week. Though analysts only call the prospect for final FDA approval a "layup" - instead of a slam dunk - heads are still spinning with a bevy of rosy forecasts out for Qnexa sales including one from Rodman & Renshaw for U.S. sales of $3B by 2020 and global sales of another $1.8B.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM | 1 Comment
  • NEM

    Newmont Mining (NEM -2.7%) trades lower after missing Q4 estimates yesterday. Earnings swung to...

    Newmont Mining (NEM -2.7%) trades lower after missing Q4 estimates yesterday. Earnings swung to a loss for the quarter, as a large write-down tied to the gold and copper producer's Hope Bay Canadian mine offset a slight boost in revenue.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM
  • BAM

    GrafTech (GTI -2.4%) adds to the losses it saw yesterday due to its Q4 revenue miss after...

    GrafTech (GTI -2.4%) adds to the losses it saw yesterday due to its Q4 revenue miss after KeyBanc downgrades shares to Hold and slashes EPS estimates. The firm cites Europe's macro problems, soft graphite electrode bookings, and rising raw materials costs as reasons for its downgrade.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:35 AM
  • TSL

    Trina Solar (TSL -2.7%) takes a hit after Wells Fargo cut the shares to Market Perform on...

    Trina Solar (TSL -2.7%) takes a hit after Wells Fargo cut the shares to Market Perform on valuation, citing the company's difficult pricing environment following its Q4 results yesterday.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM
  • COBR

    Shares of Cobra Electronics (COBR -19.1%) fall apart after the mobile communications firm...

    Shares of Cobra Electronics (COBR -19.1%) fall apart after the mobile communications firm reports taking a hit to earnings from a large customer that went bankrupt and says that a seasonal loss in Q1 is anticipated.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM
  • NDSN

    Nordson (NDSN +14.7%) trades higher after the firm's FQ2 guidance tops the estimates of...

    Nordson (NDSN +14.7%) trades higher after the firm's FQ2 guidance tops the estimates of analysts. The diverse manufacturer of precision equipment says that it will earn between $0.83 and $0.91 a share off of revenue of $313M-$326M - marking sequential growth of 16% for the period.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM
  • WTI

    A big earnings beat from W&T Offshore (WTI +6.7%) with its Q4 report helps shares take flight to...

    A big earnings beat from W&T Offshore (WTI +6.7%) with its Q4 report helps shares take flight to six-month highs. The energy concern also doubled its quarterly dividend payout to $0.08 per share.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM
  • CRM

    Salesforce.com's (CRM +7.8%) strong FQ4 report (I, II) is providing a boost to rival cloud...

    Salesforce.com's (CRM +7.8%) strong FQ4 report (I, II) is providing a boost to rival cloud software vendors NetSuite (N +4.9%) and Callidus Software (CALD +3%). (CRM transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM
  • MMSI

    Shares of Merit Medical Systems (MMSI -10.1%) drop sharply after the firm issues FY12 guidance...

    Shares of Merit Medical Systems (MMSI -10.1%) drop sharply after the firm issues FY12 guidance below the estimate of analysts. The company expects EPS of $0.67-$0.72 vs. $0.88 consensus.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM
  • PRLB

    Proto Labs (NYSE:PRLB) soars to $26.73 on its first day of trading, up 67.1% from an IPO price...

    Proto Labs (NYSE:PRLB) soars to $26.73 on its first day of trading, up 67.1% from an IPO price of $16. The company, a maker of custom prototyping parts for manufacturers, sold 4.3M shares in its offering. According to its S-1, Proto Labs posted revenue of $98.9M (+52% Y/Y) in 2011, and net income of $18M. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:51 AM
  • RENN

    Renren (RENN -1.2%) is downgraded to Sell at Deutsche Bank, as the Chinese social networking...

    Renren (RENN -1.2%) is downgraded to Sell at Deutsche Bank, as the Chinese social networking platform ramps up investment in R&D and new product promotions. The firm expects the expenses to significantly affect profitability in the next 4-6 quarters, viewing visibility of return on the investments as "weak at the current stage."

     
     
     
     
    | 9:42 AM | 1 Comment
  • IDIX

    Idenix Phaemaceuticals (NASDAQ:IDIX) -2% after reporting Q4 revenue of -$0.7M (the result of a...

    Idenix Phaemaceuticals (NASDAQ:IDIX) -2% after reporting Q4 revenue of -$0.7M (the result of a charge related to stock sales) and EPS of -$0.18; the latter missed by $0.04. Idenix also isn't providing any 2012 guidance, and instead merely says it has enough cash to last the next 12 months. Brean Murray is reiterating a Sell, and expressing pessimism about the prospects for Idenix's IDX184 hepatitis drug.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:34 AM
  • VMED

    Virgin Media (NASDAQ:VMED) +2% premarket following reports the company is considering options...

    Virgin Media (NASDAQ:VMED) +2% premarket following reports the company is considering options for select rental properties. The U.K.’s second-largest pay-TV company reportedly has hired lease breakers to help dispose of surplus rental properties to cut costs.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM
  • KDN

    Shares of Kaydon (NYSE:KDN) push up 13.1% premarket after the company announces that a special...

    Shares of Kaydon (NYSE:KDN) push up 13.1% premarket after the company announces that a special dividend of $10.50 per share will be paid in March. The manufacturing firm will fund the $337 million special dividend through available cash balances and committed bank credit availability. (Earlier: earnings)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:54 AM | 3 Comments
  • S

    Clearwire (CLWR) -6.4% premarket after Google (NASDAQ:GOOG) discloses its intent to sell its...

    Clearwire (CLWR) -6.4% premarket after Google (NASDAQ:GOOG) discloses its intent to sell its 6.5% stake, or ~29.4M shares, in the company to Sprint (NYSE:S). (SEC filing)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:41 AM | 6 Comments
  • UL

    Unilever (NYSE:UL) -2.3% premarket and trading lower overseas on worries about increased...

    Unilever (NYSE:UL) -2.3% premarket and trading lower overseas on worries about increased competition due to Procter & Gamble's (NYSE:PG) cost-cutting plans. "P&G will be creating more flexibility that could impact peers, such as Unilever," an ING analyst says. "We believe P&G could make another leap forward with this plan just as Unilever was about to catch up."

     
     
     
     
    | 8:32 AM
  • KDN

    Kaydon (NYSE:KDN): Q4 EPS of $0.40 misses by $0.05. Revenue of $108.1M (+3.1% Y/Y) misses by...

    Kaydon (NYSE:KDN): Q4 EPS of $0.40 misses by $0.05. Revenue of $108.1M (+3.1% Y/Y) misses by $14M. Shares +9.9% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:15 AM
  • CYBX

    Cyberonics (NASDAQ:CYBX): FQ3 EPS of $0.34 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $54.5M (+15.7% Y/Y) beats...

    Cyberonics (NASDAQ:CYBX): FQ3 EPS of $0.34 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $54.5M (+15.7% Y/Y) beats by $1.5M. Shares +3.4% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:10 AM
  • CLDX

    Celldex Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CLDX) slips 6.0% in premarket trading after announcing a public...

    Celldex Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CLDX) slips 6.0% in premarket trading after announcing a public offering of its common stock for an undisclosed amount.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:12 AM
  • KCP

    Kenneth Cole bids to take Kenneth Cole Productions (NYSE:KCP) private, offering $15/share in...

    Kenneth Cole bids to take Kenneth Cole Productions (NYSE:KCP) private, offering $15/share in cash. Mr. Cole is already an owner of 47% of the firm. The offer values the company at about $280M, a 14.8% premium to last night's close ($13.07). Shares +5.9% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:11 AM
